Package moxie

Moxie: a wicked good Java mocking library.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Cardinality<T>
    Domain-specific language methods used to specify how many times an event (method call, sequence of method calls) is expected to occur.
    Check<C extends Check<C,R>,R>
    Domain-specific language methods for setting out the details of a retrospective mock validation.
    ClassCheck<C>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications on static methods and constructors.
    ClassExpectation<T>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set expectations on static methods and constructors.
    Expectation<E extends Expectation<E,R>,R>
    Domain-specific language methods for setting out the details of a mock object expectation.
    Group
    Represents an ordered list of expectations that should occur in a strict order across mocks; or, an unordered set of expectations which should be separately verifiable as complete.
    LambdaCheck<R>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications using lambda syntax.
    LambdaExpectation<R>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set mock expectations using lambda syntax.
    MoxieControl
    Primary point of interaction between Moxie and test classes.
    ObjectCheck<T>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications on mock object instances.
    ObjectExpectation<T>
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set expectations on mock object instances.
    Predicate<T>
    Interface for a method object that returns true or false depending on whether an input value matches some criteria.
    ThrowingRunnable
    Interface for a no-arg method object that does not return a value.
    ThrowingSupplier<T>
    Interface for a no-arg method object that returns a value.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Moxie
    Static class of convenience methods for Moxie, a wicked good Java mocking library.
    MoxieMatchers
    Static class whose methods magically signal Moxie to flexibly match parameters of a mock expectation.
    MoxieRule
    JUnit 4 MethodRule which automatically sets up mocks prior to each test method, and verifies them afterwards.
    MoxieRunner
    JUnit 4 unit test runner which automatically sets up mocks prior to each test method, and verifies them afterwards.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    MoxieOptions
    Options that can be specified in the creation of mocks, spies or groups.
  • Error Summary 
    Error Description
    MoxieFailedCheckError
    Error thrown by Moxie when a Check fails.
    MoxieFailedVerificationError
    Error thrown by Moxie when verification of a group or a mock/spy object uncovers unfulfilled expectations.
    MoxieSyntaxError
    Error thrown by Moxie in some cases of incorrect mocking syntax.
    MoxieUncheckedInvocationError
    Error thrown by Moxie when checkNothingElseHappened() finds one or more unchecked invocations.
    MoxieUnexpectedError
    Error thrown by Moxie on an unexpected error condition.
    MoxieUnexpectedInvocationError
    Error thrown by Moxie when a method that has not been expected has been invoked on a PRESCRIPTIVE mock.
    MoxieZombieMethodInvocationError
    Error thrown when an attempt is made to invoke the original implementation of a method prepared for mocking by PowerMock (final/private/static methods, constructors, or any method on a final class).
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    AutoMock
    Denotes that Moxie.autoMock() should populate fields on the object held in this field as if it had itself been passed as a parameter to Moxie.autoMock().
    GroupOptions
    Denotes that Moxie.autoMock() should use the specified options when creating the Group that will be injected into this field.
    Mock
    Denotes that Moxie.autoMock() should automatically populate a field on a test with a mock object.
    Spy
    Denotes that Moxie.autoMock() should automatically wrap the contents of a field in a spy object.

Package moxie Description

Moxie: a wicked good Java mocking library.
